entries.title: Lucity Mobile Product News
entries.author: Nicole Schmidt
entries.contentSnippet: We have a lot of recent changes and upcoming plans for mobile users we want to share! New Features for Lucity for iPhone® and ...
entries.content:
We have a lot of recent changes and upcoming plans for mobile users we want to share!

New Features for Lucity for iPhone® and iPad® Now Available

In late August we released an update to Lucity Mobile for iPad, iPhone, and iPod Touch® (1.60) which includes

  • Additional support for ArcGIS? Online feature services
  • Support for form level defaults
  • JPEG image uploads (smaller sizes!)
  • Security improvements and some bug fixes

Another release which provides better support for iOS 9 will be available in the next 10 days to 2 weeks.

Coming Soon for Android™

In the next couple months be on the lookout for a new Android tablet release which includes:

  • “Show All” allowing authorized users to select from all items instead of just items valid for the current category of work.
  • Quick Lookup on the dashboard
  • Optional location logging
  • Security improvements

There will also be a new Android phone release which adds task start and end date to the task grid.

Lucity Warehouse Mobile

Right before the Lucity Annual Conference and Training in September, our Lucity Warehouse mobile applications went live. These are bar code driven applications targeted for warehouse managers. They include:

  • PO receipts
  • Part transfers
  • Part stock counts
  • Inventory adjustments
  • Issuing parts to employees
  • Looking up parts
  • Downloading or uploading images for a part
  • Adding parts to Work Orders
  • Viewing recent transactions
  • Support for iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad
  • Support for Android Tablets and Phones

Looking Ahead for iPad Offline Support

Another big project in the works is offline support for the iPad. This application will allow crews to take assets, work orders, requests, and maps offline and add and edit data while disconnected from WIFI or 3G/4G.

Check out these new mobile releases and updates and let us know what you think. Leave a comment below or if you have an idea for an enhancement, head over to Lucity Listens.

Apple, the Apple logo, iPad, iPhone, and iPod touch are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.

Android is a trademark of Google Inc.

ArcGIS is a trademark, service mark, or registered mark of Esri in the United States, the European Community, or certain other jurisdictions. Other companies and products or services mentioned herein are trademarks, service marks, or registered marks of their respective mark owners.

entries.title: Staff Spotlight >> Roy McGregor
entries.author: lucitycolin
entries.contentSnippet: Roy McGregor (@LucityRoy) Professional My job title is… Development Dragon But here’s what I really do… Develop modules for the ...
entries.content:
Roy McGregor (@LucityRoy)

Professional

My job title is… Development Dragon

But here’s what I really do… Develop modules for the web and fix bugs in the web software.

I’m making a difference at Lucity by… Trying to understand how the modules by asking questions when something doesn’t make sense to me. In order for the code to work flawlessly I need to know how it will be used.

I find my biggest (work-related) challenge to be… Explaining a problem I have so people can understand it.

But the greatest (work-related) reward is… Getting a complex architecture of code working the first time I test it.

My favorite part of my day is… Lunch, so I can get beat in Super Smash Bros by Eugene.

One reason I love working at Lucity is… It is a really relaxed place to work. Lots of benefits most Job don’t have.

Personal

My ultimate goal in life is to… Be awesome.

One album I could never part with is… I assume this is music, I don’t have a music album that I cannot part with. I like Eminem but I could part with him. My answer is: The matrix.

My favorite website is… I don’t really know, I suppose it would either be Engadget or N4G one is a video game site the other is a technology news site.

My odd superhero power is… How about a super hero power I want. This would be teleportation. I don’t like driving 50 minutes to and from work every day!

My favorite lunch spot is… The [Lucity] Game room for games. Also Spicy Basil Thai restaurant.

My favorite food is… Chinese, Which every one of the developers know because I always choose Happy Dragon for our Lunch and Learns.

My pet is… I have a cat, She is pure white and likes to play peekaboo.

My pet peeve or something I really dislike is… I suppose it would be people who shake their feet when siting on a bench with me causing the bench/floor to shake. But I do it too so I can’t be that upset about it.

entries.title: Lucity 2015r2 is Here
entries.author: Nicole Schmidt
entries.contentSnippet: This week we released Lucity 2015r2.  Big improvements and changes are in this release including: A new dashboard and time ...
entries.content:
This week we released Lucity 2015r2. Big improvements and changes are in this release including:

  • A new dashboard and time sheet user interface
  • Live WYSIWYG dashboard editing on the web
  • A new work scheduler application
  • A new graphic interface for managing tire installations
  • New modules for Storm Water Quality management
  • New modules for Street Intelligent Transportation Systems
  • New work estimating tools
  • Construction modules on the web
  • Plus many new enhancements in GIS, Work, Water, Storm, Trees, and more

In addition to this long list of new features, this release also includes a tool to consolidate all of the numerous GBA* databases into a single new Lucity database. Stay tuned for some details on how this unification process works in the August edition of Looking into Lucity in your email inbox.

Here is a brief peek at just a few of the new features in Lucity 2015r2

We hope you join us at ACT in Kansas City in a few weeks to see this in action. If you have any suggestions, please feel free to leave a comment below or visit us at Lucity Listens.

entries.title: Ch ch ch ch changes…
entries.author: Ali Tuttle
entries.contentSnippet: And so it goes, as with everything, we are changing it up a bit in the Client Services Team and wanted to share our news with ...
entries.content:
And so it goes, as with everything, we are changing it up a bit in the Client Services Team and wanted to share our news with you!

Implementation Team

  • Wow – this team is seeing growth and we aren’t stopping yet! Our stellar sales team continues to knock it out of the park, so much so that we are anticipating a need to bring in additional implementers (someone’s got to implement all of these awesome new members of the Lucity family – enter our fantastic Lucity Implementation Team!). If you know of someone whose technical prowess, organizational and people skills are a force to be reckoned with, please steer them to our job posting at http://www.lucity.com/pages/careersimpspec and have them get in touch.
  • We are in the midst of implementing a new Project Management tool here in the implementation team – Mavenlink Project Management software (mavenlink.com). We are going to be rolling this out soon to use for helping us keep our projects on track. This tool will help us with our project plans, schedules and overall project communication internally as well as with you, our clients! Be on the lookout for this should we begin working on an implementation with you in the future.

Support Team

  • New faces – We welcomed Mike Schuckman to our team back in March and just this week we have two other new Support Specialists joining our team – Tiffany DeLong and Mike Konovalske.
    • Mike S. recently finished a stint at MRI Global – a records management company – after graduating with a BS in Geography and Spanish and a MS in Environmental & Urban Geoscience. He has been actively taking support tickets all summer so you may have already been able to chat it up with him.
    • Tiffany graduated with a BS in Biology (with an emphasis in Natural Resources & Wildlife Conservation) last December and is joining us fresh off of a summer internship with one of our clients –the City of Overland Park, KS. She spent the summer supporting the City with their water quality activities related to NPDES as part of the Clean Water Act. And bonus for us, as part of these efforts, she got to use the Lucity software!
    • Mike K. is another unique new hire. He spent the summer as an intern with Lucity. His main charge was to assist with the creation of a new evaluation data set for our internal teams as well as prospective clients as they are trying out our software before they purchase it. He graduated last May with a BS in Agriculture (with an emphasis in Parks Management & Conservation and Natural Resource Management).

Please join us in welcoming them as you begin to hear them on the phones as well as see them at the ACT!

  • New places – Two of our Support Specialists relocated this year.
    • Earlier this year, Scott Malone and his wife relocated to Denver, CO. He is still providing technical support services as a Support Specialist and works our 10am-7pm CST shift almost exclusively. I’m sure he is a familiar voice to many of you on the West coast!
    • At the beginning of the summer, Jason Swain relocated to the St. Louis, MO area where his fiancé is doing her residency. He also continues to be a valuable part of our team as a Support Specialist.

Phew! So as you can see, there is no shortage of excitement among our Client Services Team. I’m looking forward to seeing you all at the ACT in Kansas City next month!

entries.title: Press Release :: Lucity and eGovsolutions Announce Canadian Partnership
entries.author: Jennifer Cairns
entries.contentSnippet: Lucity, Inc. and eGovsolutions announce a partnership to bring LucityAM to Canada. “We’re excited to expand our target market ...
entries.content:
Lucity, Inc. and eGovsolutions announce a partnership to bring LucityAM to Canada. “We’re excited to expand our target market with Canadian public-sector agencies through this partnership with eGovsolutions”, says Jim Graham (@LucityJim), Lucity’s Chief Operating Officer.

Since the 1980’s Lucity has focused on developing creative solutions that respond directly to the issues cities face, now and in the future. The best-of-breed LucityAM Enterprise Asset Management software provides highly-developed customizable-off-the-shelf (COTS) tools that help organizations manage their infrastructure, resources, and maintenance activities. Offering tight integration with the Esri ArcGIS® platform, LucityAM software provides the advantages of thinking and working geographically.

With LucityAM you can:

  • Easily configure interoperable desktop, web, mobile, and map user interfaces to address the specific needs of your operations and maintenance staff.
  • Facilitate field-to-finish workflows that support your asset management program.
  • Proactively plan, budget, and schedule your annual work plans.

“With our new Canada-wide Lucity partnership, eGovsolutions will provide a complete and comprehensive software suite for all local governments”, says Glynis Fleming of eGovsolutions.

eGovsolutions is the Canadian provider of Trimble eGovernment solutions which include Feedback (customer service\community engagement) and ePermit services.

With eGovsolutions’ existing Trimble citizen-facing products and the LucityAM asset management software suite, eGovsolutions will help local Canadian government realize the “connected city” concept; enabling cities to bridge technology gaps and “do more with less”.

You can read more about eGovsolutions on their website: http://egovsolutions.ca/
